info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 2:43PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Transylvania, northwestern Greenville and northwestern Pickens Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 243 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Brevard, or 4 miles south of Rosman, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rosman, Table Rock State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Dupont State Forest, Lake Jocassee, Jocassee Gorges, Gorges State Park, Pumpkintown, Connestee and Rocky Bottom. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
